trans-unit.source: How to use the API Inspector to trace calls in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to use the API Inspector to trace calls in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to trace calls using the API Inspector in Azure API Management.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to trace calls using the API Inspector in Azure API Management.

trans-unit.source: API Management provides an API Inspector tool to help you with debugging and troubleshooting your APIs.
trans-unit.target: API Management provides an API Inspector tool to help you with debugging and troubleshooting your APIs.

trans-unit.source: The API Inspector can be used programmatically and can also be used directly from the developer portal.
trans-unit.target: The API Inspector can be used programmatically and can also be used directly from the developer portal.

trans-unit.source: In addition to tracing operations, API Inspector also traces <linkText>policy expression</linkText><title></title> evaluations.
trans-unit.target: In addition to tracing operations, API Inspector also traces <linkText>policy expression</linkText><title></title> evaluations.

trans-unit.source: For a demonstration, see <linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features</linkText><title></title> and fast-forward to 21:00.
trans-unit.target: For a demonstration, see <linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features</linkText><title></title> and fast-forward to 21:00.

trans-unit.source: This guide provides a walk-through of using API Inspector.
trans-unit.target: This guide provides a walk-through of using API Inspector.

trans-unit.source: API Inspector traces are only available to the <linkText>administrators</linkText><title></title> of your API Management service instance.
trans-unit.target: API Inspector traces are only available to the <linkText>administrators</linkText><title></title> of your API Management service instance.

trans-unit.source: API Inspector traces are only returned when making calls to a <linkText>protected product</linkText><title></title> that requires a subscription key.
trans-unit.target: API Inspector traces are only returned when making calls to a <linkText>protected product</linkText><title></title> that requires a subscription key.

trans-unit.source: To use API Inspector, add an ocp-apim-trace: true request header to your operation call, and then download and inspect the trace using the URL indicated by the ocp-apim-trace-location response header.
trans-unit.target: To use API Inspector, add an ocp-apim-trace: true request header to your operation call, and then download and inspect the trace using the URL indicated by the ocp-apim-trace-location response header.

trans-unit.source: This can be done programatically, and can also be done directly from the developer portal.
trans-unit.target: This can be done programatically, and can also be done directly from the developer portal.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows how to use the API Inspector to trace operations using the Basic Calculator API that is configured in the <linkText>Manage your first API</linkText><title></title> getting started tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows how to use the API Inspector to trace operations using the Basic Calculator API that is configured in the <linkText>Manage your first API</linkText><title></title> getting started tutorial.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't completed that tutorial it only takes a few moments to import the Basic Calculator API, or you can use another API of your choosing such as the Echo API.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't completed that tutorial it only takes a few moments to import the Basic Calculator API, or you can use another API of your choosing such as the Echo API.

trans-unit.source: Each API Management service instance comes pre-configured with an Echo API that can be used to experiment with and learn about API Management.
trans-unit.target: Each API Management service instance comes pre-configured with an Echo API that can be used to experiment with and learn about API Management.

trans-unit.source: The Echo API returns back whatever input is sent to it.
trans-unit.target: The Echo API returns back whatever input is sent to it.

trans-unit.source: To use it, you can invoke any HTTP verb, and the return value will simply be what you sent.
trans-unit.target: To use it, you can invoke any HTTP verb, and the return value will simply be what you sent.

trans-unit.source: To get started, click developer portal in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To get started, click developer portal in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: Operations can be called directly from the developer portal which provides a convenient way to view and test the operations of an API.
trans-unit.target: Operations can be called directly from the developer portal which provides a convenient way to view and test the operations of an API.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't yet created an API Management service instance, see <linkText>Create an API Management service instance</linkText><title></title> in the <linkText>Get started with Azure API Management</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't yet created an API Management service instance, see <linkText>Create an API Management service instance</linkText><title></title> in the <linkText>Get started with Azure API Management</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>API Management developer portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>API Management developer portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click APIs from the top menu, and then click Basic Calculator.
trans-unit.target: Click APIs from the top menu, and then click Basic Calculator.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Echo API</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Echo API</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Try it to try the Add two integers operation.
trans-unit.target: Click Try it to try the Add two integers operation.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Try it</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Try it</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Keep the default parameter values, and select the subscription key for the product you want to use from the subscription-key drop-down.
trans-unit.target: Keep the default parameter values, and select the subscription key for the product you want to use from the subscription-key drop-down.

trans-unit.source: By default in the developer portal the Ocp-Apim-Trace header is already set to true.
trans-unit.target: By default in the developer portal the Ocp-Apim-Trace header is already set to true.

trans-unit.source: This header configures whether or not a trace is generated.
trans-unit.target: This header configures whether or not a trace is generated.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Send</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Send</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Send to invoke the operation.
trans-unit.target: Click Send to invoke the operation.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Send</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Send</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the response headers will be an ocp-apim-trace-location with a value similar to the following example.
trans-unit.target: In the response headers will be an ocp-apim-trace-location with a value similar to the following example.

trans-unit.source: The trace can be downloaded from the specified location and reviewed as demonstrated in the next step.
trans-unit.target: The trace can be downloaded from the specified location and reviewed as demonstrated in the next step.

trans-unit.source: To review the values in the trace, download the trace file from the ocp-apim-trace-location URL.
trans-unit.target: To review the values in the trace, download the trace file from the ocp-apim-trace-location URL.

trans-unit.source: It is a text file in JSON format, and contains entries similar to the following example.
trans-unit.target: It is a text file in JSON format, and contains entries similar to the following example.

trans-unit.source: Check out the other topics in the <linkText>Get started with advanced API configuration</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Check out the other topics in the <linkText>Get started with advanced API configuration</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Watch a demo of tracing policy expressions in <linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Watch a demo of tracing policy expressions in <linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Fast-forward to 21:00 to see the demo.
trans-unit.target: Fast-forward to 21:00 to see the demo.
